newsitem.title: UK: SOCCER-WEST HAM TURN DOWN OFFER FOR CROAT BILIC.
newsitem.headline: SOCCER-WEST HAM TURN DOWN OFFER FOR CROAT BILIC.

text.p: English premier league side West Ham have rejected a lucrative offer for Croatian midfielder Slaven Bilic.
According to newspaper reports Tottenham Hotspur are willing to pay 2.5 million pounds sterling ($3.9 million) for Bilic.

"If you have world-class players there will constantly be inquiries and, yes, we have had one for Slaven," West Ham managing director Peter Storrie said. "But I can't say which club it is, and anyway, we have turned it down.
"If Slaven left it would have to be on the basis that we wanted to let him go, and that is not the situation."
While Bilic looks set to stay at West Ham, Dean Holdsworth may be leaving fellow Londoners Wimbledon.
The striker, valued at around 4.0 million pounds ($6.3 million) has put in a transfer request after being dropped for his side's league match against Leeds last week.
"As far as I'm concerned, if he wants to go I will not stand in his way," manager Joe Kinnear said after the match. "You can't compete with egos so I'll just sit by the phone and wait for offers."
